entry.title: As BUSD Dies, Tether’s USDT Soaks Up Another $1 Billion
entry.summary: With the fall of a top-three stablecoin, Tether is emerging as a clear winner.

entry.title: Stablecoin Markets Pick Winners and Losers Ahead of SEC Paxos Lawsuit
entry.summary: Binance USD's market cap has dropped to $15 billion, down 31% from its all-time high.

entry.title: NFT Traders Flex Their Blur Airdrops: Here’s Who Got the Most Tokens
entry.summary: The Blur airdrop apparently benefited wash traders the most, with the top three wallets each claiming at least $1.5M worth of tokens.

entry.title: Andrew Tate Reveals How Much Bitcoin He’s Had Seized by Authorities
entry.summary: The controversial influencer boasted about his shrewd Bitcoin investments—but Romanian authorities have nabbed at least some of it.

entry.title: Bored Ape Owner Burns $169K NFT to Move It From Ethereum to Bitcoin
entry.summary: The owner of BAYC #1626 burned the NFT, to symbolically shift its existence to Bitcoin. But Yuga Labs says it’s an illegitimate Ape.

entry.title: Lawmakers Continue to Quarrel Over ‘Crypto Nightmare’
entry.summary: Senators are tying themselves in knots over how to regulate the digital asset industry.

entry.title: Blur Launches Long-Awaited Token Airdrop for Ethereum NFT Traders
entry.summary: Traders who claimed Blur’s “care packages” can open them up today to claim BLUR governance token rewards.

entry.title: UK Financial Regulator Cracks Down on Illegal Crypto ATMs
entry.summary: The FCA and local authorities are taking aim at crypto ATMs operating illegally in the country, investigating several sites in Leeds.

entry.title: gm Week in Review: SEC Targets Staking, a16z Doesn’t Get Its Way, NFTs Popping
entry.summary: In our February 11, 2023 week in review episode, Matthew Diemer, Stacy Elliott, and Stephen Graves talk about the latest developments in the FTX case, 3AC founders trying for a comeback, a16z losing on a big Uniswap vote despite holding 15 million UNI tokens, and NFTs roaring back with CryptoPunks, Bored Apes, and Ordinals NFTs selling hot. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Trade Sideways as Market Mulls Mixed CPI Report
entry.summary: Inflation slowed to 6.4%, but markets, including Bitcoin and Ethereum, are still parsing through several mixed signals from the CPI report.

entry.title: What is Bakkt? Everything You Need to Know (2023)
entry.summary: Bakkt is the brainchild of the New York Stock Exchange owners. By creating a cryptocurrency exchange with US government oversight, Bakkt wants to make trading crypto assets as normal as trading shares.

entry.title: FTX’s Turkish Entities Dismissed From US Bankruptcy Proceedings
entry.summary: A U.S. court has approved an earlier request made by FTX to leave its Turkish entities out of the domestic bankruptcy proceedings.

entry.title: Judge Halts SEC, CFTC Cases Against Bankman-Fried Until Criminal Trial Concludes
entry.summary: The decision may limit the “judicial overlap” between the cases and limit the amount of information available to the Bankman-Fried defense.

entry.title: BNB Token Plunges as Binance, Paxos Shutter BUSD Stablecoin Product
entry.summary: Binance's native exchange token BNB has taken a beating as regulators take aim at the firm's stablecoin product BUSD.

entry.title: Layoffs Hit Solana NFT Marketplace Magic Eden, Sheds 22 Employees
entry.summary: The digital collectible giant announced the reduction in workforce as part of a restructuring.

entry.title: LACMA Art Museum Acquires NFT Collection With CryptoPunk, Art Blocks
entry.summary: The famed Los Angeles art museum accepted a donated collection of NFTs that’s potentially worth millions of dollars.

entry.title: Ordinals Gain Momentum With 76,000 NFTs Minted to Bitcoin
entry.summary: While the community remains divided, Ordinals has taken the Bitcoin ecosystem by storm.

entry.title: Trump NFTs Are Mooning Again—Here’s What’s Going On
entry.summary: The ex-president’s Polygon NFT trading cards just hit a new peak price following a sharp decline in January. Why are they hot again?

entry.title: Co-Founder of Banned @NFT Instagram Account Seeks $6 Million for Lil Baby Crypto Dice Game
entry.summary: The @NFT account was permanently banned on Twitter and Instagram last year. Co-founder Aaron Avruskin is back hunting for new investors.

entry.title: Paxos Says It's 'Prepared to Vigorously' Fight SEC Lawsuit
entry.summary: The company today confirmed it has received a Wells Notice from the regulatory agency.

entry.title: New ‘Sinbad’ Bitcoin Mixer Unmasked As Formerly Sanctioned Blender
entry.summary: Blockchain analytics firm Elliptic says that “Sinbad” is just a new name for the notorious mixing service favored by North Korean hackers.

entry.title: Bakkt Backs Out of Consumer Business to Focus on B2B Offering
entry.summary: Cryptocurrency platform Bakkt is making a pivot away from its consumer-focused app to provide “scalable business-to-business technology solutions.”

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Iris Energy Expands Data Center to Triple Hash Rate
entry.summary: While other mining firms retreat, a new deal with chipmaker Bitmain brings new life.

entry.title: Solana Monkey Business Has a New Owner: NFT Exchange Hadeswap
entry.summary: One of Solana’s most popular NFT projects just changed hands, but will the DAO of NFT holders be receptive to the new owners?

entry.title: Draft EU Rules Will Force Banks to Give Cryptocurrencies Highest Risk Rating
entry.summary: Until December 2024, European banks may be legally forced to back their crypto holdings with hefty capital requirements.

entry.title: Tron Revenue, Transactions Surge in Q4 2022: Messari
entry.summary: Average active daily addresses, transactions and quarterly revenue on Tron all increased by double digits in the last quarter.

entry.title: For a $5 NFT Pass, You Can Watch the New Nouns TV Show Debut
entry.summary: An adult animated series based on the Nouns NFT project just debuted, offering a very meta take on the decentralized IP.

entry.title: Paxos Halts BUSD Minting as SEC Prepares Lawsuit
entry.summary: Crypto brokerage firm Paxos Trust will “end its relationship with Binance” for the BUSD stablecoin.

entry.title: Cathie Wood’s Ark Invest Has Bought Almost $20M in Coinbase Stock Since January
entry.summary: Six weeks into 2023, long-time Bitcoin bull Cathie Wood continues to relentlessly load up on Coinbase stock.

entry.title: Coinbase ‘Will Defend Staking in Court if Needed’: CEO
entry.summary: The crypto exchange's CEO Brian Armstrong looks to be gearing up for a fight with the SEC over the legality of crypto staking services.

entry.title: What Are the Pros and Cons of DeFi?
entry.summary: DeFi is a continually growing sector within finance. We break down the positives and negatives of this alternative blockchain-based economic ecosystem.

entry.title: DigiDaigaku’s Super Bowl Ad Baffles Viewers, But the Free NFTs Are Still Selling for $700
entry.summary: Some viewers say the QR code pointed them to Twitter instead of the mint site, but those who claimed the free NFTs are making bank.

entry.title: IRS Should Focus on Centralized Exchanges: Blockchain Exec
entry.summary: Blockchain Association Executive Director Kristin Smith quips that "The IRS are reasonable people."

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Gensler Unleashes Critics for Cracking Down on Kraken
entry.summary: And crypto philanthropists this week raised millions for earthquake victims in Turkey and Syria.

entry.title: BlackRock ETF? There's a Token For That
entry.summary: A Swiss company is offering a token tied to a BlackRock ETF that tracks hundreds of big American tech stocks. But you can't get the token in America.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin, Ethereum See First Week of Losses This Year
entry.summary: Crypto markets ended up in the red for the first time in 2023 after the SEC's Kraken crackdown tanked coin prices.

entry.title: Major Paris Art Museum to Exhibit CryptoPunks, Autoglyphs NFTs
entry.summary: Centre Pompidou, Europe's largest modern art museum, will showcase the digital works as part of its first exhibition focused on NFTs.

entry.title: What the Kraken Crackdown Means for Ethereum Staking
entry.summary: Kraken’s settlement with the SEC over its staking-as-a-service product has put other exchanges on notice—but it may be a boon for decentralized alternatives.

entry.title: Bankrupt Genesis Unveils Plan to Pay Back Creditors
entry.summary: Digital Currency Group plans to sell both Genesis Global Holdco and Genesis Global Trading to pay back creditors.

entry.title: Terra May Be at Risk Again—But This Time Is Different
entry.summary: Terra Classic, the network born of Terra's $60 billion collapse, may be at risk of takeover by a staking service wielding disproportionate power.

entry.title: Reddit Has Given Away Over a Million Super Bowl NFTs on Polygon
entry.summary: Reddit’s NFL promo has pushed its Collectible Avatars total to nearly 10 million NFTs minted since last summer.

entry.title: Bill Murray Discusses NFT Project, First Members-Only Event
entry.summary: Comedic legend Bill Murray sits down with Decrypt at his first exclusive party for NFT holders in Oceanside, California. He describes the project’s origins and why it didn’t feel “mercenary” for him to create an NFT-based membership club.

entry.title: gm: Kristin Smith and the Crypto Crusade in Washington
entry.summary: Kristin Smith is Executive Director of the Blockchain Association, which advocates for crypto policy in Washington D.C.—an exhausting effort that Sam Bankman-Fried was closely involved in, until he set it all on fire. Kristin tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott how SBF and FTX set things back, but there are still positive signs from crypto friendly voices in Congress. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Week in Review: Tech Layoffs, Porsche NFTs, Ted Cruz
entry.summary: In our January 28, 2023 week in review episode, Dan Roberts, Matthew Diemer, and Kate Irwin talk about more layoffs in crypto and broader tech (including how Google botched its layoffs), the NFT market rebound and Porsche’s NFT drop (fail or surprise success?), Sam Bankman-Fried’s latest claims about FTX US and the surprising list of big companies on the FTX creditor list, and Ted Cruz’s weird effort to get DC vendors to accept Bitcoin. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Web3 Is Disrupting Video Streaming: Myco, Theta Labs, and Actor David Bianchi
entry.summary: At an investor event in L.A. hosted by watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Sander Lutz moderated a discussion about Film3 with Myco CCO Phil McKenzie, Theta Labs BD Head Andrea Berry, and actor and filmmaker David Bianchi, whose Web3 series "RZR" got funding through NFT drops.

entry.title: How Web3 and NFTs Are Disrupting Film: Myco, Livepeer, Ava Labs, Bad Grrls Creative Club
entry.summary: At an investor event in New York hosted by the watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Dan Roberts moderated a lively chat about Film3 with Phil McKenzie from Myco, Toni Thai Sterrett the founder of NFT member collective Bad Grrls Creative Club, Doug Petkanics the founder of decentralized video hosting platform Livepeer, and Daniel Killeen of Avalanche blockchain developer Ava Labs.

entry.title: 'Iron Man' Comic Artist Sean Chen on Marvel vs. Web3
entry.summary: Marvel and DC Comics alum Sean Chen argues that while studios have made billions, comic artists aren't seeing even a fraction of that wealth.

entry.title: Marvel Artist Sean Chen on How Artificial Intelligence Will Shape Comics
entry.summary: "Eventually there's still a human brain that needs to be involved," Chen said of AI being used to create comics.

entry.title: Actor David Bianchi Previews His Web3 TV Series 'RZR'
entry.summary: Veteran actor David Bianchi spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson right before a public table read for Bianchi's upcoming drama series "RZR," to be distributed through Gala Films. The show is already greenlit and will be set in a dystopian future Los Angeles, with Ethereum and other digital assets as part of the plot. Bianchi also conducted two NFT drops to build engagement from fans.

entry.title: gm: Farokh and the Rug Radio Roadmap
entry.summary: Meet Mr. NFT: @Farokh, who preaches daily to hundreds of thousands of NFT faithful, and is trying to building Rug Radio into a fully formed Web3 media company. Dan Roberts and Kate Irwin from the gm podcast talk to Farokh about Rug DAO and all things NFT culture. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Big Bold Predictions for Crypto in 2023
entry.summary: Will Sam Bankman-Fried serve prison time? Who will be the next crypto company to go bankrupt, or the next founder to see their reputation dissolve? Will we get a new crypto law this year? Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Matthew Diemer of the gm podcast crew kicked off the new year by trading predictions for 2023. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
